10th Annual
Bioengineering Day

May 19th, 2016 at Biocom


REGISTER NOW

Bioengineering Day is a celebration of the department, its current research by faculty and students, and the field of bioengineering itself.


This year, BE Day will be kicking off the department's 50th Anniversary Celebration!

This student-run event will feature senior design projects, a keynote speaker, graduate student presentations, research seminars, and the exciting Quiz Bowl. Bioengineering Day sets the stage for students to interact with field experts to learn new things and become increasingly aware of trends and developments within the field.

BE Day is planned between three of the University of California, San Diego's bioengineering student organizations: The International Society for Pharmaceutical Engineering, The Bioengineering Graduate Society, and The Biomedical Engineering Society.

This upcoming BE Day is particularly special as it will be the kick-off event of the Bioengineering Department's 50th Anniversary Celebration. Expect an extensive amount of visiting alumni, researchers, and professionals to learn from and also to meet. It's going to be unforgettable!

Dr. Ivor Royston
Founder of Hybritech, Inc. and Forward Ventures

Dr. Royston is an oncologist, researcher, entrepreneur, and venture capitalist. He is best known for his efforts to fund biotechnology companies that show promise in their efforts in science, technology, or medicine. During his work at the University of California, San Diego, Royston was on the front lines of developing cancer gene therapies, and was one of the first individuals to use monoclonal antibodies to treat patients with melanoma, leukemia, and T cell lymphoma.


Dr. Hamilton Smith
Nobel Laureate in Medicine

Dr. Hamilton O. Smith received an A.B. degree in mathematics at the University of California, Berkeley in 1952 and a M.D. from Johns Hopkins University in 1956. One year after he joined the Microbiology Department at Johns Hopkins in 1967, he discovered the first Type II restriction enzyme (HindII) and determined the sequence of its cleavage site; he was a co-recipent of the Nobel in Medicine for this discovery in 1978.

Quiz Bowl

Every year, BE Day hosts the final round of Quiz Bowl! For several weeks before the final showdown, undergraduates battle with their wits against their peers to answer questions from their classes, pop culture, and more!

Lectures

Guest speakers share their insights on their respective fields, which are usually related to research, medicine, academia, or industry. Whether it be about their stories getting to where they are today, or a sneak peek into their research area of interest, all of the topics highlight the multidsciplinary nature of the field.

Poster Presentations

At BE Day, undergraduate seniors are invited to present their Senior Design Projects to be judged by graduate students and faculty in the department. Additionally, graduate students are given the opportunity to show off their own research to professors!


A photograh of one of the undergraduate teams in the final round of Quiz Bowl 2015!


One of the upperclassmen students presenting their Senior Design Project to BE Day attendees.

Dr. Joseph Panetta, CEO of Biocom

Dr. Geert Schmid-Schoenbein, Chair of the Bioengineering Department

Dr. Anthony Ratcliffe, Chair of the IAB
9:00a - 9:45a
Keynote Address | Illumina Theatre

Dr. Ivor Royston, Founder of Hybritech, Inc. and Forward Ventures
9:45a - 10:30a
BENG Slam | Illumina Theatre

BENG Slam is modeled after Grad Slam, a competition held by each of the University of California campuses where graduate students are challenged to explain their thesis in three minutes for a general audience. At BE Day, BENG graduate students will be competing against each other in this fast-paced competition!

Event Location

This year's event will be held at Biocom, a member-driven organization which supports the Southern California life sciences community through a diverse range of initiatives and programs.
